actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands

official_title: To require a study of the feasibility of establishing the John Lewis Civil Rights Trail System, and for other purposes.
short_title: John Lewis Civil Rights Trail System Act
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: John Lewis Civil Rights Trail System Act - Directs the Archivist of the United States to conduct a study of the feasibility of establishing the John Lewis Civil Rights Trail System to mark the geographic locations in the United States, including U.S. territories, of historically significant events related to struggles for civil rights based on racial equality. Requires the Secretary of the Interior to establish and maintain individual trails marking the geographic locations of such events. Authorizes the establishment of such a trail in each state where a significant civil rights event occurred.

titles.title: John Lewis Civil Rights Trail System Act
To require a study of the feasibility of establishing the John Lewis Civil Rights Trail System, and for other purposes.
